009package GenericFilterDemos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.Kernel1D;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
017import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
018
019/**
020 * This ImageJ plugin shows how to construct a separable linear filter using the classes {@link LinearFilterSeparable}
021 * and {@link GenericFilter}. This plugin works for all types of images. On RGB color images, the filter is applied
022 * independently to the three color channels. The active image is modified.
023 *
024 * @author WB
025 */
026public class Linear_Filter_3x3_Separable implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
027        
028        static double SIGMA = 3.0;
029
030    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
031        return DOES_ALL;
032    }
033
034    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {        
035                Kernel1D kernelX = new Kernel1D(new float[] {1,2,1});
036                Kernel1D kernelY = new Kernel1D(new float[] {1,2,1});
037                
038                GenericFilter filter = new LinearFilterSeparable(kernelX, kernelY);
039        filter.applyTo(ip);
040    }
041
042}
